intro: Warczewiczella guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese warczewiczella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
